00026 /* Peripheral group ----------------------------------------------------------- */
00031 /* Includes ------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00032 #include "lpc17xx_rit.h"

00035 /* If this source file built with example, the LPC17xx FW library configuration
00036  * file in each example directory ("lpc17xx_libcfg.h") must be included,
00037  * otherwise the default FW library configuration file must be included instead
00038  */

00041 #else
00042 #include "lpc17xx_libcfg_default.h"

00046 
00047 /* Public Functions ----------------------------------------------------------- */
00052 /******************************************************************************//*
00053  * @brief               Initial for RIT
00054  *                                      - Turn on power and clock
00055  *                                      - Setup default register values
00056  * @param[in]   RITx is RIT peripheral selected, should be: LPC_RIT
00057  * @return              None
00058  *******************************************************************************/
00059 void RIT_Init(LPC_RIT_TypeDef *RITx)
00060 {
00061         CHECK_PARAM(PARAM_RITx(RITx));
00062         CLKPWR_ConfigPPWR (CLKPWR_PCONP_PCRIT, ENABLE);
00063         //Set up default register values
00064         RITx->RICOMPVAL = 0xFFFFFFFF;
00065         RITx->RIMASK    = 0x00000000;
00066         RITx->RICTRL    = 0x0C;
00067         RITx->RICOUNTER = 0x00000000;
00068         // Turn on power and clock
00069 
00070 }
00071 /******************************************************************************//*
00072  * @brief               DeInitial for RIT
00073  *                                      - Turn off power and clock
00074  *                                      - ReSetup default register values
00075  * @param[in]   RITx is RIT peripheral selected, should be: LPC_RIT
00076  * @return              None
00077  *******************************************************************************/
00078 void RIT_DeInit(LPC_RIT_TypeDef *RITx)
00079 {
00080         CHECK_PARAM(PARAM_RITx(RITx));
00081 
00082         // Turn off power and clock
00083         CLKPWR_ConfigPPWR (CLKPWR_PCONP_PCRIT, DISABLE);
00084         //ReSetup default register values
00085         RITx->RICOMPVAL = 0xFFFFFFFF;
00086         RITx->RIMASK    = 0x00000000;
00087         RITx->RICTRL    = 0x0C;
00088         RITx->RICOUNTER = 0x00000000;
00089 }
00090 
00091 /******************************************************************************//*
00092  * @brief               Set compare value, mask value and time counter value
00093  * @param[in]   RITx is RIT peripheral selected, should be: LPC_RIT
00094  * @param[in]   time_interval: timer interval value (ms)
00095  * @return              None
00096  *******************************************************************************/
00097 void RIT_TimerConfig(LPC_RIT_TypeDef *RITx, uint32_t time_interval)
00098 {
00099         uint32_t clock_rate, cmp_value;
00100         CHECK_PARAM(PARAM_RITx(RITx));
00101 
00102         // Get PCLK value of RIT
00103         clock_rate = CLKPWR_GetPCLK(CLKPWR_PCLKSEL_RIT);
00104 
00105         /* calculate compare value for RIT to generate interrupt at
00106          * specified time interval
00107          * COMPVAL = (RIT_PCLK * time_interval)/1000
00108          * (with time_interval unit is millisecond)
00109          */
00110         cmp_value = (clock_rate /1000) * time_interval;
00111         RITx->RICOMPVAL = cmp_value;
00112 
00113         /* Set timer enable clear bit to clear timer to 0 whenever
00114          * counter value equals the contents of RICOMPVAL
00115          */
00116         RITx->RICTRL |= (1<<1);
00117 }
00118 
00119 
00120 /******************************************************************************//*
00121  * @brief               Enable/Disable Timer
00122  * @param[in]   RITx is RIT peripheral selected, should be: LPC_RIT
00123  * @param[in]   NewState        New State of this function
00124  *                                      -ENABLE: Enable Timer
00125  *                                      -DISABLE: Disable Timer
00126  * @return              None
00127  *******************************************************************************/
00128 void RIT_Cmd(LPC_RIT_TypeDef *RITx, FunctionalState NewState)
00129 {
00130         CHECK_PARAM(PARAM_RITx(RITx));
00131         CHECK_PARAM(PARAM_FUNCTIONALSTATE(NewState));
00132 
00133         //Enable or Disable Timer
00134         if(NewState==ENABLE)
00135         {
00136                 RITx->RICTRL |= RIT_CTRL_TEN;
00137         }
00138         else
00139         {
00140                 RITx->RICTRL &= ~RIT_CTRL_TEN;
00141         }
00142 }
00143 
00144 /******************************************************************************//*
00145  * @brief               Timer Enable/Disable on debug
00146  * @param[in]   RITx is RIT peripheral selected, should be: LPC_RIT
00147  * @param[in]   NewState        New State of this function
00148  *                                      -ENABLE: The timer is halted whenever a hardware break condition occurs
00149  *                                      -DISABLE: Hardware break has no effect on the timer operation
00150  * @return              None
00151  *******************************************************************************/
00152 void RIT_TimerDebugCmd(LPC_RIT_TypeDef *RITx, FunctionalState NewState)
00153 {
00154         CHECK_PARAM(PARAM_RITx(RITx));
00155         CHECK_PARAM(PARAM_FUNCTIONALSTATE(NewState));
00156 
00157         //Timer Enable/Disable on break
00158         if(NewState==ENABLE)
00159         {
00160                 RITx->RICTRL |= RIT_CTRL_ENBR;
00161         }
00162         else
00163         {
00164                 RITx->RICTRL &= ~RIT_CTRL_ENBR;
00165         }
00166 }
00167 /******************************************************************************//*
00168  * @brief               Check whether interrupt flag is set or not
00169  * @param[in]   RITx is RIT peripheral selected, should be: LPC_RIT
00170  * @return              Current interrupt status, could be: SET/RESET
00171  *******************************************************************************/
00172 IntStatus RIT_GetIntStatus(LPC_RIT_TypeDef *RITx)
00173 {
00174         uint8_t result;
00175         CHECK_PARAM(PARAM_RITx(RITx));
00176         if((RITx->RICTRL&RIT_CTRL_INTEN)==1)    result= SET;
00177         else return RESET;
00178         //clear interrupt flag
00179         RITx->RICTRL |= RIT_CTRL_INTEN;
00180         return result;
00181 }
00182 
00187 #endif /* _RIT */
